permissions.explanation: Google Analytics uses client fetch to attribute sessions more accurately

tid.helpText: The measurement ID is the unique identifier of your Google Analytics 4 account. [Learn more](https://www.semrush.com/blog/google-analytics-tracking-id/#how-to-find-google-analytics-tracking-id)

uid.helpText: User ID/Visitor ID lets you associate your own identifiers with individual users so you can connect their behavior across different sessions and on various devices and platforms. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/analytics/devguides/collection/ga4/user-id?technology=gtagjs)

en.helpText: The value of this field will be sent as Event Name to Google Analytics. [Learn more](https://support.google.com/analytics/answer/1033068?hl=en)

ni.helpText: Non-interaction events are not taken into account when Google Analytics calculates bounces and session duration. [Learn more](https://support.google.com/analytics/answer/1033068?hl=en#NonInteractionEvents)

__zaraz_setting_hideOriginalIP.helpText: This will prevent sending the visitor IP address to Google Analytics 4

__zaraz_setting_ecommerce.helpText: Enable forwarding of Zaraz E-commerce API events to Google Analytics as part of the enhanced e-commerce tracking feature. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/analytics/devguides/collection/analyticsjs/enhanced-ecommerce#ecommerce-tracking)

__zaraz_setting_ga-audiences.helpText: Enable Audiences collection through Google Analytics

__zaraz_setting_baseDomain.helpText: Manually set the domain for all Google Analytics cookies
